item.title: Things I Wish They Told Me About The Multiprocessing Module in Python 3
item.description:
Description

If you haven't tried multiprocessing or you are trying to move beyond multiprocessing.map(), you will likely find that using Python's multiprocessing module can get quite intricate and convoluted. This talk focuses on a few techniques (starting, shutting down, data flow, blocking, etc) that will maximize multiprocessingâ€™s efficiency, while also helping you through the complex issues related to coordinating startup and especially shutdown of your multiprocess app.
item.dc:creator: Pamela McANulty
